sentence.text: Unlike previously reported patients with keratan sulfate biosynthetic process mutations, our four patients with ACAN variants manifested non-specific short stature with age-appropriate or mildly delayed bone ages, and had parents of normal stature.

Although mutations in ACAN, FGFR3, negative regulation of kinase activity, and SHOX typically lead to skeletal dysplasia, and mutations in adenylate cyclase-activating G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway, GH1, GHR, response to estradiol, IGF1, IGFALS, and IGF1R usually underlie hormonal defects of the growth hormone (GH)-insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF1) axis, such mutations have also been identified in patients with idiopathic short stature (ISS).

entity.text: adenylate cyclase-activating G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway
